PageTitle: reset nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock
FuncDef: The reset nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command deletes an IP addresses to be locked and VPN instance information.
CLIs: reset nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address [ <lockip-address> [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] ] manual-unlock

ParaDef.Info:
Deletes an IP address to be locked in NAT attack defense.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance whose information is to be deleted in NAT defense.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address 10.1.1.1 manual-unlock
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you manually lock an address in a NAT blacklist, run the reset nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command to delete the IP address.
Configuration Impact
The reset nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command deletes the manually locked state from a NAT blacklist. The IP address has to be re-locked if needed.
Precautions
The reset nat flow-defend reverse-blacklist lock-ip-address manual-unlock command takes effect only on the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
